abstract_summ: The goal of this study was to develop an adapted susceptible-infected-removed (SIR) model to predict the trajectory of the COVID-19 pandemic in North Carolina (NC) and the Charlotte metropolitan region . The SIR-Int model accounted for a stay-at-home intervention and imperfect detection of cases . The results highlight the importance of incorporating local context into pandemic forecast modeling, as well as the need to remain vigilant .
